title: Feedback Design Strategies for Game-Based Mathematics Learning

context.additional_context: Designed for Novice Professional Learners in Managerial/Leadership Roles to Experience Effective Feedback Models in a Game-Based Learning Environment

learning_goals: Learners can revise math problem-solving strategies with 80% accuracy through real-time feedback provided during gameplay.
Learners can differentiate feedback types (answer verification, hints, process analysis) and explain how to utilize them contextually.
Learners can synthesize feedback from diverse in-game agents (peers, system, self-assessment) to improve learning outcomes by 15%.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
